html.p: These reporting devices have a time drift of more than 1 second compared to the event time as reported by Splunk
Consider checking the NTP settings of the listed devices

ol.li: Make sure your ntp server points to a valid NTP server
Make sure your ntp source uses an interface that has routing to the NTP server
Check your clock timezone and clock summer-time statements

html.p: If you are not seeing anything in the "Time drift between event time and device's reported event time" table, please ensure that your Syslog server is not replacing the device's time with its local time. It should instead be appending the local time upon reception.

table.title: Time drift between event time and device's reported event time

search.query: eventtype=cisco_ios $tenant_indexes$ | dedup host | eval dtime1=strptime(device_time, "%Y %b %e %H:%M:%S.%Q %Z") | eval dtime2=strptime(device_time, "%b %e %H:%M:%S.%Q %Z") | eval dtime3=strptime(device_time, "%b %e %H:%M:%S %Z") | eval dtime4=strptime(device_time, "%b %e %H:%M:%S.%Q") | eval dtime5=strptime(device_time, "%b %e %H:%M:%S") | eval dtime6=strptime(device_time, "%b %e %Y %H:%M:%S.%3N %Z") | eval device_time2=coalesce(dtime1,dtime2,dtime3,dtime4,dtime5,dtime6) | eval difference=_time-device_time2 | convert timeformat="%s" ctime(difference) AS seconds | `sla-sec2time(seconds,time_difference)` | table _time,host,device_time,time_difference | sort -time_difference
eventtype=cisco_ios $tenant_indexes$ reliable_time=false | dedup host | table _time, device_time, host
